results.title: Linda's film on menstruation
results.creator_credit: Linda Feferman, Georghe Eichen and Phoenix Films
results.brief_description: Humorous film designed to explode the myths surrounding menstruation and inform on the facts. Includes an animated segment explaining the physiological process of menstruation.

results.title: Mother may I?
results.creator_credit: Linda Feferman, Gina Blumenfeld and Shared Futures Films
results.brief_description: SEX EDUCATION - Treats aspects of teeage sexuality in a narrative context. A sixteen-year-old girl fears that she may be pregnant but is reluctant to confide in her parents. Depicts her reactions to her predicament, as well as those of her boyfriend and eleven-year-old sister who share her anxiety. Raises issues surrounding pregnancy, adoption, abortion, and family relationships. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Albert Speer: the last nazi
results.creator_credit: Brian Nolan, W.R. Callaghan, Global Television Network and Lakeville Group
results.brief_description: Several years after his release from Spandau prison, where he completed his twenty-year sentence for war crimes, Albert Speer is interviewed by Canadian reporter Patrick Watson. The interview reveals Speer’s assessment of his life, and chronicles the rise and fall of the Nazi regime, shedding light on the behaviour of a great many Germans who fell under Hitler’s spell. Valuable documentary footage, including some of Speer’s home movies.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Brian Nolan, W.R. Callaghan, Global Television Network and Lakeville Group

results.title: De Gaulle: force of character
results.creator_credit: Don Thompson, New York Times Productions and Nielsen-Ferns
results.brief_description: Part of the “Leaders of the 20th century: portraits of power” series, this episode shows how Charles De Gaulle, through his determination and force of character, was able to provide a focal point for the Free French during the occupation years in France. Incorporates footage of De Gaulle in England and North Africa during the war years. Narrated by Henry Fonda.

results.title: And what about sugar ?
results.brief_description: This film glosses over the adverse effects of the consumption of sugar by implying that sugar is good for you in controlled doses, and that proper tooth care, rather than diet will prevent dental cavities. No other credits available.

results.title: Special trade
results.brief_description: A story about a friendship between a young girl and her grandfather. As a baby, the young girl was taken for outings and taught to walk by her grandfather. Then, one day he returns home from the hospital in a wheelchair and it is the young girl’s turn to take her grandfather for walks. Based on the book entitled “Special Trade” by Sally Whitman.

results.title: Sculpture of the Parthenon
results.creator_credit: Howard Tracy and Hugh Baddeley Productions
results.brief_description: Provides a comprehensive coverage of the sculpture of the Parthenon. In addition to the remains in Athens, the film covers the full scale replica of the Parthenon at Nashville, Tennessee; the model and exhibits in the Royal Ontario Museum of Toronto, Canada. Suitable for upper secondary level.
